com.alexgilleran.icesoap.request
Interface RequestFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
RequestFactoryImpl
public interface RequestFactory

Creates Requests, passing them a default, Apache HTTP Client based SOAPRequester implementation.

Author:
Alex Gilleran

Method Detail

buildRequest

<ReturnType> Request<ReturnType> buildRequest(String url,
                                              SOAPEnvelope soapEnvelope,
                                              String soapAction,
                                              Class<ReturnType> resultClass)
Builds a new Request for a non-list return type. Use this kind of request when you want only one returned object.

Type Parameters:
ReturnType - The type of the object that will be returned by this request when executed (if successful)
Parameters:
url - The url to POST the request to
soapEnvelope - The SOAPEnvelope to post
soapAction - The SOAP action to use. Can be set to null as some SOAP services use this and some don't.
resultClass - The class for of the return type.
Returns:
A request with the passed parameters, ready to have observers registered and be executed.

buildListRequest

<ReturnType> ListRequest<ReturnType> buildListRequest(String url,
                                                      SOAPEnvelope soapEnvelope,
                                                      String soapAction,
                                                      Class<ReturnType> resultClass)
Builds a ListRequest with the passed parameters. Use this sort of request when you want to get a list of the same object back from the service.

Type Parameters:
ReturnType - The type of the objects inside the list that will be returned by this request when executed (if successful)
Parameters:
url - The url to POST the request to
soapEnvelope - The SOAPEnvelope to post
soapAction - The SOAP action to use. Can be set to null as some SOAP services use this and some don't.
resultClass - The class to go inside the list (e.g. List<ReturnType> ) for of the return type.
Returns:
A request with the passed parameters, ready to have observers registered and be executed.
